page.title: 01MELSONBY-Village & Surrounds
page.content: {Melsonby}is 5 miles North of{Richmond and stands on higher ground with the {A66}1 mile to the South and the {A1(M) 1 mile to the East. It stands at a crossroads and has a {Norman church}to its Eastern end which is a local landmark. During Saxon times it was a settlement and after the Norman conquest became part of the honour of Richmond. The area seems to have been fairly prosperous throughout the centuries with some{ copper mining} for a short period in the{mid 19th. century.} For most of this century{ agriculture has predominated although the{ numbers {employed} in this industry have {considerably reduced} with {greater {mechanisation} on the farms. The growing of{ cereal crops}has{increased whilst the rearing of{ livestock} has {diminished.}
